greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse of A066884 considered as a permutation of the positive integers.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Let w(n)=A000120(n) be the 'weight' of n; i.e. the number of 1's in the binary expansion of n. Let p(n)=A068076(n) be the number of positive integers < n with the same weight as n. Then a(n) = binomial(w(n)+p(n), 2) + p(n) + 1.
mathematica: w[n_] := Plus@@IntegerDigits[n, 2]; p[n_] := Plus@@MapThread[Binomial, {Flatten[Position[Reverse[IntegerDigits[n, 2]], 1]]-1, Range[w[n]]}]; a[n_] := Binomial[w[n]+p[n], 2]+p[n]+1
program: foreach(1..10_000){$i=eval join "+", split //, sprintf "%b", $_; $j=$r[$i]++; print "$_ ",$j+1+($i+$j)*($i+$j-1)/2,"\n"} # _Ivan Neretin_, Mar 02 2016
results.author: Jared Ricks (jaredricks(AT)yahoo.com), Jan 31 2002
ext: Offset changed to 1 by _Ivan Neretin_, Mar 02 2016
